quizzes.question_text: Look at this clock. What time will it be in eleven hours and forty-five minutes?
quizzes.question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: Read the time on the clock. It is 12:00.
Count by hours to find 11 hours after 12:00. This is 11:00.
Now add 45 minutes to 11:00. This is 11:45.
It will be 11:45. This clock shows 11:45.
solution_image_tag: An analog clock face with blue rim showing the time 11:45. The hour hand points between 11 and 12, and the minute hand points to 9. Black arrows on the clock hands emphasize their positions.
quizzes.backend_description: An analog clock face with a blue rim. The clock shows 12:00 (noon or midnight), with both the hour hand and minute hand pointing straight up at the 12. The clock has all numbers from 1-12 clearly marked around the face.
image_choice_tags_backend_description: An analog clock with bright blue rim showing 9:15 (quarter past nine). The hour hand points between 9 and 10, while the minute hand points to 3. Features clear black numbers 1-12, small dots marking minutes between numbers, and black hour and minute hands on a white face.

An analog clock with bright blue rim showing 9:00 exactly. The hour hand points directly at 9, while the minute hand points straight up to 12. Identical design to option A with clear black numbers, minute markers, and black hands on a white face.

quizzes.question_text: Look at this clock. What time will it be in nine hours?
quizzes.question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: Read the time on the clock. It is 4:00.
Count by hours to find 9 hours after 4:00. This is 1:00.
Since we're not adding any minutes, the time remains 1:00.
It will be 1:00. This clock shows 1:00.
solution_image_tag: An analog clock face with blue rim showing the time 1:00. The hour hand and minute hand are positioned correctly for this time. Black arrows on the clock hands emphasize their positions.
quizzes.backend_description: An analog clock face with a blue rim. The clock shows 4:00, with the hour hand and minute hand positioned accordingly. The clock has all numbers from 1-12 clearly marked around the face.
image_choice_tags_backend_description: An analog clock with bright blue rim showing 1:00 exactly. The hour hand points directly at 1, while the minute hand points straight up to 12. Features clear black numbers 1-12, small dots marking minutes between numbers, and black hour and minute hands on a white face.

An analog clock with bright blue rim showing 2:45 (quarter to 3). The hour hand points between 2 and 3, while the minute hand points to 9. Identical design to option A with clear black numbers, minute markers, and black hands on a white face.

Now add 15 minutes to 11:00. This is 11:15.
It will be 11:15. This clock shows 11:15.
solution_image_tag: An analog clock face with blue rim showing the time 11:15. The hour hand and minute hand are positioned correctly for this time. Black arrows on the clock hands emphasize their positions.
quizzes.backend_description: An analog clock face with a blue rim. The clock shows 12:00, with the hour hand and minute hand positioned accordingly. The clock has all numbers from 1-12 clearly marked around the face.
image_choice_tags_backend_description: An analog clock with bright blue rim showing 1:30 (half past 1). The hour hand points between 1 and 2, while the minute hand points to 6. Features clear black numbers 1-12, small dots marking minutes between numbers, and black hour and minute hands on a white face.

An analog clock with bright blue rim showing 11:15 (quarter past 11). The hour hand points between 11 and 12, while the minute hand points to 3. Identical design to option A with clear black numbers, minute markers, and black hands on a white face.

quizzes.question_text: Look at this clock. What time will it be in ten hours and thirty minutes?
quizzes.question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: Read the time on the clock. It is 2:00.
Count by hours to find 10 hours after 2:00. This is 12:00.
Now add 30 minutes to 12:00. This is 12:30.
It will be 12:30. This clock shows 12:30.
solution_image_tag: An analog clock face with blue rim showing the time 12:30. The hour hand and minute hand are positioned correctly for this time. Black arrows on the clock hands emphasize their positions.
quizzes.backend_description: An analog clock face with a blue rim. The clock shows 2:00, with the hour hand and minute hand positioned accordingly. The clock has all numbers from 1-12 clearly marked around the face.
image_choice_tags_backend_description: An analog clock with bright blue rim showing 12:30 (half past 12). The hour hand points between 12 and 1, while the minute hand points to 6. Features clear black numbers 1-12, small dots marking minutes between numbers, and black hour and minute hands on a white face.

An analog clock with bright blue rim showing 6:00 exactly. The hour hand points directly at 6, while the minute hand points straight up to 12. Identical design to option A with clear black numbers, minute markers, and black hands on a white face.

quizzes.question_text: Look at this clock. What time will it be in three hours and thirty minutes?
quizzes.question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: Read the time on the clock. It is 8:30.
Count by hours to find 3 hours after 8:30. This is 11:30.
Now add 30 minutes to 11:30. This is 12:00.
It will be 12:00. This clock shows 12:00.
solution_image_tag: An analog clock face with blue rim showing the time 12:00. The hour hand and minute hand are positioned correctly for this time. Black arrows on the clock hands emphasize their positions.
quizzes.backend_description: An analog clock face with a blue rim. The clock shows 8:30, with the hour hand and minute hand positioned accordingly. The clock has all numbers from 1-12 clearly marked around the face.
image_choice_tags_backend_description: An analog clock with bright blue rim showing 8:00 exactly. The hour hand points directly at 8, while the minute hand points straight up to 12. Features clear black numbers 1-12, small dots marking minutes between numbers, and black hour and minute hands on a white face.

An analog clock with bright blue rim showing 12:00 exactly. The hour hand points directly at 12, while the minute hand points straight up to 12. Identical design to option A with clear black numbers, minute markers, and black hands on a white face.
